sentences: Õpilased on juba lõpetanud inglise keele kursi.
context: In Estonian, 'kurssi' is the partitive case form of the word 'kursus', which means a course or class. The partitive case in Estonian typically indicates an incomplete action, but here it's used to specify being enrolled in or attending a specific course. This form would be used when talking about being in a particular class or studying a particular subject.
